Functions¶

myapp.routes.add()¶

Adds a task to the To Do List. :return: Refreshes reminder page and adds a task to list.

myapp.routes.addevents()¶

Sends user to HTML page called “addevents.html” :return: Render template to addevents.html

myapp.routes.complete(id)¶

Turns the a to-do reminder from the To Do List as complete. :param id: The database table ID :return: Refreshes rhe dashboard and removes the text that matches the database ID in there.

myapp.routes.dashboard()¶

Requires a login to access. Goes to site where there is a Google Calendar, Resources, and more features. :return: Redirects to dashboard URL

myapp.routes.delete(id)¶

Deletes task in To Do list. :param id: The database table ID :return: Refreshes reminder.HTML and remove a task form the list

myapp.routes.editevents()¶

Sends user to HTML page called “editevents.html” :return: Render template to editevents.html

myapp.routes.index()¶

The homepage of the website. Gives a summary of the purpose of the website. :return: Goes to HTML file called “index.html”. This is the homepage before logging in.

myapp.routes.login()¶

Goes to login page and requests for username and password. :return: If username and password is the same as the on in the database, redirect user to dashboard. Else, print invalid message.

myapp.routes.logout()¶

Log user out if user is logged in. :return: Redirects user to index.html

myapp.routes.reset_request()¶

Goes to a site that requests for a valid email in order to send a token link. :return: Prints the message, “An email has been sent to reset your password” and sends a token link to the email inputted. Redirects user to login page after wards. Else, keeps them at same site.

myapp.routes.reset_token(token)¶

Goes to a secured site that set a new password for the corresponding email. User inputs a new password and once submitted, the old password is replaced and new password is in its place/ :param token: The token link sent via email. Required in order to access the page :return: If token is wrong or expired, print invalid message and redirects user back to the site that requests for a valid email. Else, output is committed in database, a message saying “Your password updated!, and redirects user to homepage.”

myapp.routes.resources()¶

Sends user to HTML page named “resources”. :return: Redirects user to resource page.

myapp.routes.send_reset_email(user)¶

Sends a token link to the receiver, whom is the email the user inputted in reset_request(). Token link is made up of randomly generate characters and expires in 30 minutes. The link will redirect the user to the reset password page.

myapp.routes.signup()¶

Goes to registration page and requests for email, username, and password. Stores members in database. :return: Sends user to login page after submitting a valid username, email, password. Else, it will not leave the page.

class myapp.models.Todo(**kwargs)¶

Database table for To Do list. Contains text, user id, and boolean flag

complete¶

Database Column for completed work

id¶

Database Column for ID

text¶

Database Column for text

user_id¶

Database Column for User ID

class myapp.models.User(**kwargs)¶

Database for holding user’s username, email, password, and ToDoList.

Todolist¶

Database relationship between tables User and Todo

email¶

Database column for email

get_reset_token(expires_sec=1800)¶

Generates a token that expires in 30 minutes and is randomly generated. :param expires_sec: Expires in 30 minutes :return: Returns a unique token

id¶

Database column for ID

password¶

Database column for password

username¶

Database column for username

static verify_reset_token(token)¶

Takes a token, tries to load the token and returns a user id. :param token: The token :return: Returns a user id

class myapp.forms.LoginForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

A form for entering username and password. Takes strings and verifies the data in the current database.

password = <UnboundField(PasswordField, ('Password',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.InputRequired object>]})>¶

Requires a string.

remember = <UnboundField(BooleanField, ('Remember me',), {})>¶

Remembers the user next time they attempt to log in.

submit = <UnboundField(SubmitField, ('Log In',), {})>¶

Submit checks if the username and password is valid in the database. If so, the site will take user to the dashboard ( via def dashboard() in routes.py).

username = <UnboundField(StringField, ('Username',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.InputRequired object>, <wtforms.validators.Length object>]})>¶

Requires a string that is at 4-15 characters long.

class myapp.forms.RegisterForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

A form to register your email, username, and password. Takes the input(e.g, email) and outputs it to the database. If email is already taken, then it will print an error message.

email = <UnboundField(StringField, ('Email',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.InputRequired object>, <wtforms.validators.Email object>, <wtforms.validators.Length object>]})>¶

Requires a string that is at 1-50 characters long.

password = <UnboundField(PasswordField, ('Password',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.InputRequired object>, <wtforms.validators.Length object>]})>¶

Requires a string that is at 4-80 characters long.

username = <UnboundField(StringField, ('Username',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.InputRequired object>, <wtforms.validators.Length object>]})>¶

Requires a string that is at 4-15 characters long.

validate_email(email)¶
class myapp.forms.RequestResetForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

A form that asks for a valid email. This page opens when you click the link “Forgot Password” located in the login page. If valid, sends the email via yagmail a token link. The token characters are randomly generated and expires in 30 minutes due to the functions in models.py. If invalid, print invalid message and prevents code from sending a request token.

email = <UnboundField(StringField, ('email',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.InputRequired object>, <wtforms.validators.Email object>, <wtforms.validators.Length object>]})>¶
submit = <UnboundField(SubmitField, ('Request Password Reset',), {})>¶
class myapp.forms.ResetPasswordForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

A form that changes the password. Link can only be accessed by having a non-expired token link. User enters a new string (password) and submits. The new password then replaces the old password in the database.

password = <UnboundField(PasswordField, ('password',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.InputRequired object>, <wtforms.validators.Length object>]})>¶

Requires a string that is at 4-40 characters long.

submit = <UnboundField(SubmitField, ('Reset Password',), {})>¶

Submits the input as the new password.
